title: Authorizes the Long Island power authority to propose certain rate changes to the public service commission
summary: Authorizes the Long Island power authority to propose certain rate changes to the public service commission in the amount of two and one-half percent.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2581

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public service law, in relation to the Long Island power
authority

PURPOSE:
To codify and clarify the requirement that LIPA rates may not be
increased an average of two and one half percent over a twelve month
period without the approval of the Public Service Commission (PSC).

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1 requires average customer rate increases by the Long Island
Power authority exceeding 2.5% in a twelve month period to be
approved by the Public Service Commission after a full evidentiary
hearing.

Section 2 requires LIPA to notify the Public Service Commission of
any rate increase exceeding 2.5% over a twelve month period.

Section 3 establishes the effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:
LIPA rates have been raised seven times since 2001 increasing more
than 34% without ever going before the Public Service Commission as
required in the agreement authorizing LIPA to issue debt. LIPA has
included costs within its fuel surcharge that are not part of the
industry standard and which the PSC would not allow other utilities
to include in a fuel surcharge. Long Island rate payers will benefit
from the comprehensive review of its practices by the professional
staff of the public service commission on rate requests of LIPA.
LIPA's businesses and home owners have suffered due to the lack of
strong oversight of the practices and ratemaking of LIPA.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10, S.2727A/A.8441; 2007-08, S.3410/A,6164; 2005-06,
S.6827/A.10073

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
180 days after it shall have become law; provided that effective
immediately the Public Service Commission shall institute the
proceedings necessary to review and/or amend the Long Island Power
Authority's ongoing tariff filings to ensure charges for the
furnishing or rendition of electric power or of any related service
at the lowest level consistent with sound fiscal operating practices
which provide for safe and adequate service; such proceedings shall
be completed on or before such effective date; provided further,

effective immediately the Public Service Commission and the Long
Island Power Authority shall amend and/or repeal any rule or
regulation necessary for the implementation of this act on its
effective date and are authorized and directed to be made and
completed on or before such effective date.
